entry.title: Parliament seeks to encourage return of veterans to military

media:group.media:title: Parliament seeks to encourage return of veterans to military
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia's Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan announced that pushing for the recognition of the Armenian Genocide is not a top priority for his ministry. üìç Armenian lawmakers introduced a bill yesterday that would allow veterans to keep their pensions while returning to service in combat units. üìç The Armenian National Committee of America has decided to endorse neither major U.S. presidential candidate. üìç Human Rights Watch called on Armenian lawmakers to withdraw or significantly revise the controversial bill that would require mandatory installation of police-accessible CCTV cameras throughout Yerevan.

entry.title: AI education to be introduced to schools across Armenia

media:group.media:title: AI education to be introduced to schools across Armenia
media:group.media:description:
The STEP.ai program, developed by AGBU Armenian Virtual College in collaboration with Synopsys Armenia and the Union of Employers of Information and Communication Technology (UE ICT), is giving Armenian high school students the essential skills in artificial intelligence. At the recent graduation ceremony, students showcased projects like face detection and image classification, demonstrating the program‚Äôs impact on their tech education. The event also marked the signing of a pivotal agreement between Armenian government officials and private sector leaders to expand AI education across the country, in a unified commitment to prepare Armenia‚Äôs youth for a tech-driven future.

entry.title: EU parliament smacks the Aliyev regime

media:group.media:title: EU parliament smacks the Aliyev regime
media:group.media:description:
In this week's episode of Insights, Eric Hacopian analyzes the European Parliament's new resolution against Azerbaijan, including potential sanctions and the call to end the EU-Azerbaijan gas deal. The discussion moves to Georgia's pivotal national elections and their implications for regional dynamics. Finally, Hacopian examines how the latest developments in the US presidential elections could impact Armenia's strategic interests and regional relationships.

entry.title: Georgian president uses derogatory language concerning Armenians

media:group.media:title: Georgian president uses derogatory language concerning Armenians
media:group.media:description:
üìç Georgia‚Äôs ceremonial president, Salome Zourabichvili, made a derogatory statement concerning Armenians while accusing the country‚Äôs ruling party of electoral fraud during the recent parliamentary elections. üìç Armenia‚Äôs ruling Civil Contract party nominated Srbuhi Galyan, Deputy Prosecutor General, as a candidate for Justice Minister. üìç The Prime Minister's office will see funding cuts in 2025, Finance Minister Vahe Hovhannisyan announced.
